summary: An email from attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez to an unnamed recipient regarding finalizing a plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein. The email indicates there is one outstanding issue and that the recipient is the last person in the chain of command needed for approval.

persons.name: Lilly Ann Sanchez
persons.context: Author of the email, working to finalize a plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein and seeking input on an outstanding issue.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the email; a plea deal is being finalized on his behalf.

connections.description: Sanchez is working to finalize a plea deal for Epstein, indicating she is acting as his attorney or legal representative.

events.title: Plea Deal Finalization Email
events.description: Attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez emails an unnamed recipient to finalize Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal, noting one outstanding issue and that the recipient is the last in the chain of command needed for approval.

keyFacts: A plea deal for Jeffrey Epstein was being finalized as of September 21, 2007.
Attorney Lilly Ann Sanchez was involved in the plea deal negotiations for Epstein.
There was one outstanding issue preventing the finalization of the plea deal at the time of the email.
The email recipient was described as the last person in the chain of command needed to approve the deal, with others apparently 'gone'.
The email is marked as attorney-client privileged and confidential.
